name: The Statler Hotel at Cornell University

reviews.text: I just completed the General Managers Program and prior to arriving at the hotel, I received a welcome letter from the GM introducing his property, this was great. He met my team and I every afternoon for lunch and Mr. Adie remembered our names. His staff is great and Mr. Aide provided inspirational leadership to his team. All of his staff from restaurant, front desk, concierge and banquet staff provided an extraordinary level of service. The Statler Chef is also responsible for me gaining additional weight due to his excellent cuisine - thank you Chef.
reviews.title: Great Hotel and Extraordinary Leadership

reviews.text: Paola Tavella - Concierge Management Trainee was a true hospitality service provider - she was there to provide support to my group and she did an amazing job at ensuring our dining reservations we made daily.
reviews.title: Exceptional hotel

reviews.text: Special thanks to Vicki Westfall for coordinating my travel plans and making the experience memorable. I will miss her prompt and efficient follow up. Thank you Ms. Leslie Morris and Mr. Kline.
reviews.title: Hotel that is also a classroom

reviews.text: Keep the good work up!
reviews.title: The enthusiasm of the staff sets this hotel apart

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Barbados '2012
reviews.title: Most Amazing Staff Ever

reviews.text: Although this is not a 5 star hotel we were extremely impressed by the positive attitude and great service by the staff/college students. A bit pricey for the area but enjoyed stay and extremely convenient if you are visiting your kids at Cornell.
reviews.title: Great attItude of staff

reviews.text: We stayed at the Statler Hotel at Cornell to take a campus tour. The Hotel is an excellent location to tour campus and to walk to "college town" for morning bagels. It is convenient to have valet parking and be centrally located to tour campus. The room was average size. It wasn't too small nor too large. It had a generous closet, a Keurig and mini fridge, with two bottles of water for convenience, and T.V. The Valet staff hustled and we had our car in minutes whenever we needed it. The staff was helpful and courteous. It was a nice place to stay. The room was very clean. I would stay there again. You can find cheaper places in the area, but for touring campus this hotel is very nice and convenient. We didn't try room service but it was available.
reviews.title: The Statler

reviews.text: Everything about our stay at the Statler surpassed our expectations, other than the slightly dated rooms, but they were clean and comfortable, and the service more than made up for the lack of luxury in the accoutrements. Everyone we encountered provided A+ service -- can't think of a hotel on earth where we have had better service, from the check-in to the room service to the valet and check-out, and everything in between. Really made for a wonderful stay. And the restaurant was first rate -- dinner and breakfast were wonderful. We are still talking about how wonderful our stay was, weeks later.
reviews.title: Luxury service

reviews.text: The hotel is run by the School of Hotel Administration. First rate service and gourmet food in their restaurant, Taverna. Stayed there b/c my son is a student there. It can be very difficult to get a reservation when there are key sporting events or graduation, etc., but if you can plan ahead it is well worth it. Many/most staff are students at this school and they are positively obsessed with delivering superior customer service. I never experienced anything like it...they're falling all over you to help and be super-friendly. Quality touches all over the hotel..too numerous to mention. I travel quite a bit on business and wish all hotels could be this outstanding. Reasonable rates as well.
reviews.title: The Statler Hotel at Cornell University-Ithaca, NY

reviews.text: Love that it's location is convenient to the Cornell campus. Love that the students from the Hotel school run it.
reviews.title: Four and three quarters really.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Statler staff could not be friendlier or more accomodating. The hotel is lovely & in a great location. Parking is $12/day & you can self park or let one of the valets park for you. They hustle to get your car to you quickly. All things considered, our recent 3 day stay was very pleasant, largely due to the employees attitudes towards their guests. They are certainly 'top notch!' Staff from other hotels could benefit by visiting the Statler to 'see how things should be done.' If you have time, make sure to visit the Ithaca Bakery & the Farmer's Market in town.
reviews.title: Great staff ~ Great location!!!

reviews.text: Perfect service, nicely appointed rooms. On the downside, the rooms tend to be a bit small and it is high priced for the area. Be sure to visit the Johnson musuem and walk to Collegetown Bagels (a landmark) for breakfast.
reviews.title: Great service, best location for visiting Cornell

reviews.text: The staff and student employees are very professional, friendly and helpful. They exceed expectations and make staying at the Statler a great experience.
reviews.title: Great Staff!

reviews.text: I have stayed at the Statler 3 times while visiting the campus. I have consistenly been impressed with the positive attitude of every student I've encountered working there. They want to satisfy you. During my most recent stay they upgraded me to a top floor room with sweeping views of the campus and Lake Cayuga beyond. I was moving my daughter home for the summer so I needed to ship things and store bags ---the staff handled all that efficiently with a very helpful attitude. The rooms are average size but nicely appointed. The beds are comfortable and the restaurant is surprisingly good. I have stayed at other places in the area but this is by far the best.
reviews.title: The enthusiasm of the staff makes this hotel a gem.

reviews.text: This is the training hotel for students at the School of Hotel Administration. The students are bright and enthusiastic and try to be as helpful as possible. The food is quite good and the rooms are nice and very functional. The gym could be expanded, but you can pay a small fee and use the more extensive school gyms nearby. The location can't be beat if you're visiting Cornell, and there are no other hotels of this caliber nearby. If only the bathrooms were a bit nicer, but what can you do?
reviews.title: Solid Hotel and THE Place to Stay at in Ithaca
Well located for Cornell - but could improve
reviews.text: If you are visiting Cornell, this is the perfect location - right in the heart of the campus. There are also stunning views over the town and valley. The hotel has a smart, but fairly unmemorable decor (it could be part of any major chain) and offers everything you might expect. This is where the problem occurs. As the hotel is connected to the Cornell Hospitality School, you would expect it to offer something a little different and certainly to be pushing the barriers a bit more. The students are also not as forthcoming in service as you would expect from this Ivy League School - They are very friendly, but again, certainly no better than your average college kid working in your local hotel/restaurant. I found I had to always approach them, rather than the service coming to me. The bedrooms are well laid out and equipped, with Aveda Amenities in the Bathroom. Room service is good, but the menu is a little limited (they do a great burger). The bar is a bit soulless and I did not dine in the restaurant, as it looked a bit dated and lacking in personality. Apart from the college, there is not much in the immediate area - so if you are looking for more variety, I would stay down in the town. OK, but could do better.
It was very surprising that the food and service at the restaurant was so poor.
reviews.title: Great room poor food

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The server was not attentive and the manager spent plenty of time chatting with us about his children while the people he should have been training were poor at their job. A server arrived with our entree while the salad plates were still in front of us and he had to scramble to deliver our meal. The food was overly salty and tough! The bedroom was first class . A good nights sleep.
reviews.title: Very nice-but expensive

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: On a trip to celebrate our anniversary, my wife and I stayed at the Statler for two nights so she could show me her old college stomping grounds. We had a traditional king bed room which was like many other hotels. Nothing special, BUT, the bed was extremely comfortable. Room was small and we were located right next to the elevator. There were a couple of conferences going on that had people constantly going to the elevator very early in the morning (5:30-6:30am). Staff was very friendly and helpful and eager to be of assistance. The Taverna Banfi, the restaurant at the hotel is OUTSTANDING. This restaurant is a must.
reviews.title: This is what a hotel should be.

reviews.text: Simply the most clean, friendliest, well designed and professional hotel to be found. The students that run this hotel are dedicated to being the finest hotel managers in the future. Everyone must do every job that is associated with running a hotel to experience all the nuances that happen in the real world. They do this well. Don't miss an opportunity to stay here, because someday, the cleaning person that turned down your sheets may be the General Manager at the Four Seasons. Outstanding.
reviews.title: The service and the staff are outstanding!

description: A Luxury Hotel In the Heart Of The Cornell Campus Nestled amidst the picturesque gorges and eclectic architecture of Cornell University, The Statler Hotel blends dignified Ivy League ambiance with the bustling energy of campus life. Experience the unique character of this elegant hotel. You will be welcomed by passionate, ambitious students from Cornell’s world-renowned School of Hotel Administration, working alongside seasoned hospitality professionals. Delight in the upscale accommodations and service you would expect from a first-class hotel. Overlooking the gorgeous Finger Lakes countryside – – only minutes from colorful downtown Ithaca – – we offer university visitors, corporate travelers, and alumni a truly unique lodging experience.
